tables.questionText: Which best describes the reason for having a drink in the past week?

rows.label: Connection / A way to feel closer to others and strengthen bonds
Status / A way to demonstrate that you have good taste
Exploration / A chance to try something new
Celebration / A way to celebrate or mark a moment or achievement
Indulgence / A source of pleasure or indulgence
Escape / An escape from stress or routine
Performance / A way to keep the night going
Tradition / A way to honor customs

tables.questionText: You said your reason for having a drink in the past week was best described as [pipe: S10a lower]. More specifically, what best describes that moment?

rows.label: A drink to bring everyone together at the start of the night
Something to sip while catching up with close friends
A drink that feels appropriate for the situation and makes me feel like I fit in at a social gathering
A go-to choice for reconnecting with someone after time apart
A drink that makes me feel confident and put-together in social settings
Something that looks elevated or premium when served
A drink that feels on-trend or buzzworthy
A drink I'd be proud to post or share on social media
A drink I've never tried before that sparks curiosity
Something with a surprising twist—flavor, format, or origin
A limited-edition or seasonal release I want to experience before it's gone
A drink that transports me somewhere new—culturally or emotionally
A drink to toast a personal win or milestone
Something festive to share when good news hits
A way to make an ordinary day or night feel a little more special
A drink I reach for when I just want what I want
A drink that feels rich, extra, or over-the-top—in the best way
A drink to help me unwind after a long or stressful day
Something I reach for when I need a mental reset
A drink that helps me slow down and be present
A go-to when I want to escape the usual and feel transported
A drink that helps me feel confident and socially on‑point for a night out
Something I choose when I want to bring my A‑game to socialize
A go-to when I want to stay in control and keep the night flowing smoothly
A drink that's always part of our holiday or seasonal celebrations
Something I serve because it's what we've always had at family gatherings
A drink that helps keep a cultural or regional tradition alive
Something I choose because it reminds me of home or loved ones
A drink that feels like I'm treating myself

changes: s1: labels - Updated all row labels to match survey answer text and removed question-prefix from questionText.
s1: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnySensitiveIndustry' combining S1r1..S1r7 to show percentage in any sensitive industry (excludes 'None of the above').
s1: derived - Marked table as derived (added NET) and set user note about select-all and terminate usage.
s6a: labels - simplified and matched to survey answer text; removed variable-prefix wording from labels.
s6a: nets - added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyHispanicOrigin' combining S6ar1 through S6ar8 to show 'Any Hispanic / Latino origin'.
s6a: userNote/baseText - marked as a Select-all question and noted it is asked only of respondents who are Hispanic or Latino (ASK IF S6=1).
s6a: readability - organized NET at top with component rows indented for clear hierarchy.
s7: labels - Replaced technical labels with clean answer text from survey and added '(Select all that apply)' user note.
s7: nets - Added a conceptual NET row 'Two or more races (NET)'. Implemented as synthetic variable _NET_TwoOrMoreRaces with netComponents referencing all S7r* binary flags.
s7: no_change - Kept original binary variables and filterValues (1 = selected).
s9: labels — Updated each row label to match survey wording and removed repetitive question text.
s9: nets — Added two NET rows: On-premise (Total) and Off-premise (Total) using the survey's on/off mapping. Marked table as derived and kept original rows.
s9: isDerived — Set to true because NET summary rows were added and this is a summary view for mean_rows.
a7_1: labels - cleaned and shortened long truncated labels to match survey answer text.
a7_1: nets - added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnySubstance' combining A7r1-A7r5 to show respondents who used any substance (excluding 'None of the above').
a7_1: derived - marked table as derived because a NET row was added; kept original component rows and 'None of the above' as standalone.
a9_1: labels - cleaned to match survey wording and removed repeated question reminder from each label
a9_1: nets - added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyCompany' rolling up all companion options (excludes 'I was alone')
a9_1: derived - marked table as derived (added NET) and added user note '(Select all that apply)'
a13b_1: labels - cleaned question text and component labels to match survey wording.
a13b_1: nets - added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyOtherDrinks' combining A13br1-A13br5; components indented under NET.
a13b_1: isDerived - set to true (NET added); userNote added '(Select all that apply)'.
a16_1: labels - cleaned long system labels to concise survey answer text.
a16_1: nets - added multi-variable NET row '_NET_A16_Any' combining A16r1..A16r10 and indented component rows underneath.
a16_1: derived - marked as derived because a NET row was added; preserved all original variables and values.
a17_1: labels - cleaned wording to remove piping and trailing question text; made labels concise and survey-accurate.
a17_1: nets - added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyA17Reason' combining A17r1-A17r9 to show respondents who selected any reason. Component rows indented under NET.
a17_1: isDerived - set to true because NET was added. userNote added '(Select all that apply)'. No exclusions applied.
a19_1: labels - cleaned and shortened each choice label to match survey wording and removed repeated pipe text
a19_1: nets - added multi-select NET 'Any reason (NET)' combining A19r1..A19r11 (excludes 'None of the above')
a19_1: header - added category header 'Reasons for choosing the brand:' for visual grouping
a19_1: metadata - set questionText to full verbatim question without number, marked as derived and added user note '(Select all that apply)'
a21: labels - cleaned verbose labels to match survey answer text (e.g., "A21r1: Tito's..." -> "Tito's Handmade Vodka").
a21: nets - added multi-variable NET row '_NET_AnyBrand' combining A21r1..A21r6 to show overall awareness of any listed brand. 'None of the above' left as standalone (indent 0).
a21: userNote - added '(Select all that apply)' to clarify question format.
a22: split into 10 attribute-level comparison tables (labels normalized to brand names).
a22: original flat overview excluded (moved to reference) because the grid is large and attribute-level comparisons are more readable.
a22: added userNote '(Select all that apply)' and set surveySection to SECTION A: OCCASION LOOP for all derived tables.
a22: normalized 'None' labels to 'None of the above (exclusive)' to clarify exclusivity.

a23_tito_s_handmade_vodka: labels - updated questionText to full survey wording and standardized scale labels; t2b - added Top 2 Box NET (4,5) and Bottom 2 Box NET (1,2); indentation - indented component scale rows under NETs; isDerived set to true; surveySection set to SECTION A: OCCASION LOOP; userNote added.
a23_grey_goose: labels - expanded questionText to full survey wording; clarified scale labels to match survey
a23_grey_goose: t2b - added Top 2 Box (4,5) NET with component rows indented
a23_grey_goose: nets - added Bottom 2 Box (1,2) NET with component rows indented
a23_grey_goose: split - preserved as split table; added tableSubtitle 'Grey Goose' and baseText to indicate who was asked
a23_ketel_one: labels - Updated questionText to full survey wording; cleaned scale labels to match survey scale text.
a23_ketel_one: t2b - Added Top 2 Box (4,5) rollup and Bottom 2 Box (1,2) rollup with component rows indented.
a23_ketel_one: no_change - Kept original scale value rows but reordered for readability and added user note and subtitle.
a23_maker_s_mark: labels - expanded questionText to full survey wording and updated row labels to match survey scale text.
a23_maker_s_mark: t2b - added Top 2 Box (4,5) rollup as a NET row and Bottom 2 Box (1,2) as a NET row; left neutral (3) as standalone.
a23_maker_s_mark: split - preserved that this is a per-brand split from A23 and added tableSubtitle to clarify.
a23_casamigos: labels - updated questionText to full A23 verbatim; clarified labels to match survey scale.
a23_casamigos: t2b - added Top 2 Box (4,5) rollup and Bottom 2 Box (1,2) rollup; indented component rows under each NET for hierarchy.
a23_casamigos: no_change - kept original scale values as component rows; treated split as intentional.
a23_don_julio: labels - Updated to full survey scale labels and normalized phrasing ('Neither likely nor unlikely');
a23_don_julio: t2b - Added Top 2 Box (4,5) NET row 'Likely (T2B)' with components indented beneath;
a23_don_julio: nets - Added Bottom 2 Box (1,2) NET row 'Unlikely (B2B)' with components indented beneath;
a23_don_julio: split/context - Marked as derived (brand-specific) and set tableSubtitle to 'Don Julio'; set surveySection to 'OCCASION LOOP' and added userNote about A21 gating.
c3: labels - cleaned to match survey wording (e.g., 'Full-time student', 'Employed full-time', etc.).
c3: nets - added multi-variable NET rows: 'Employed (Total)' combining C3r2, C3r3, C3r4; 'Out of work (Total)' combining C3r6, C3r7. Marked as derived.
c3: userNote - added '(Select all that apply)'.
c3: isDerived set to true to reflect added NET rows; sourceTableId preserved.
s2: labels - Updated questionText to remove prefix and row label to 'Age (years)'; added userNote about input and termination. No nets or splits added (mean_rows preserved).
s3: labels - Removed question prefix from questionText and ensured row labels exactly match survey answer text; no NETs or T2B added (categorical screener).
s3: userNote - Added user note indicating screener behavior for 'Prefer not to answer'.
s5: labels - Updated abbreviated labels to full income ranges matching survey (e.g., 'Less than $30' -> 'Less than $30,000', '$30' -> '$30,000 - $49,999', etc.).
s5: nets - Added two useful NET rows: 'Under $100k (NET)' combining 1-4 and '$100k+ (NET)' combining 5-9 to aid analysis. Marked table as derived since NETs were added.
s5: no_change - Kept original variable names and all original categories; did not exclude (demographic variable is required).
s6: labels - Question text cleaned to remove prefix numbering; labels confirmed to match survey. No NETs or rollups added (binary categorical).
s8: labels - cleaned questionText and row label to remove question number and truncated instructional text.
s8: no_change to numerical mean_rows structure (system will compute mean/median/stddev). Added userNote clarifying entry format.

s8_binned: derived - created a binned frequency table to show distribution (bins: 0, 1-2, 3-5, 6-10, 11-20, 21+). Marked as derived and linked to source s8. Added note about 0 being terminated in survey.
